nodes.bodyText: Should we discuss this point? Or, is everything clear? :)

It's not clear for me yet. The current implementation uses the 'normal' elementInstanceKey as scopeKey, but the MessageCorrelationKeyException is raising an incident at the variablesScopeKey level. Why is this is different?
Good question. I guess that we should have the same logic for every expression. Maybe, we forgot something.
Nope. An intermediate catch event may not have a boundary event attached to it 😁
I think we should take the transition to completing only if the event was triggered (i.e. the event trigger was found in triggerIntermediateEvent).

An intermediate catch event must have an event definition. I don't see a case when it has no event definition and we complete it immediately. I know it comes from the existing code but I have no idea why 😅
Let's remove it if you agree.

Ah, I was unaware we didn't allow these. I'd argue that there are use cases for a none intermediate catch event (e.g. milestone events). But allowing those is out of the scope of these changes. Should I create a new issue for this or is there a clear reason why we don't allow none intermediate catch events? I was unable to find GH issues about this topic.

I guess you mean the none throw event 😜
I see no reason why we should not implement it. I guess that nobody asked for it yet.
